website_summaries.verdict: A fast-heating oven and spacious cook top, along with its double-oven feature, make this range a great choice.
pros: Oven heats faster and more evenly than some electric ranges
Stovetop is spacious enough for several pots
cons: Safety shutoff is annoying when cooking low and slow recipes
Knobs can turn on easily if nudged
Lower oven is too low for some

website_summaries.verdict: Skip the LG LDG4315ST and its ineffective upgrades. Consider a simple gas model like the Kenmore 74343 or KitchenAid KGRS306BSS.
pros: The LG LDG4315ST double-oven gas range is versatile oven that's easy to use and boasts some of the fastest water boil times I've ever seen
cons: The double oven's cooking performance was inconsistent, and the accompanying LG app that connects to the oven is useless when it comes to making cooking smarter

The only con to this oven is that I have to bend down a little lower to reach the lower oven, which is only normal considering the standard height.
